Welcome to Diamond Exploratorium!
Diamonds are shimmering gemstones that have a arbitrary value and yet its allure is universal. Many cultures use them to portray the value of love, strength, and magic. Diamonds have become popular since the 19th century due to its improved cutting and polishing techniques. The value of the stone comes from its unique appearance, strength and relative rarity. Our storytelling visualization will help understand and analyze the exact attributes and their interconnectivity that determines the industrial value of these treasured diamonds.

Before getting started, let's get familiarized with each of the diamond attributes: Cut, Carat, Clarity, Color.
Now, let's see how the 4 attributes and price in U.S. dollars of 300 diamonds are related.
